intro: Feuilleea tubulifera, commonly known as the spiral leaf vine, is a tropical plant characterized by its unique spiral arrangement of leaves along its stem. It belongs to the family Araceae and is native to the rainforests of Southeast Asia. The plant features elongated, tubular leaves that curl around supporting structures, aiding in climbing. Its flowers are small and clustered in spadices, typical of the arum family. Feuilleea tubulifera is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in humid, shaded environments.
